reporting-org.narrative: Department of Health and Human Services

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Ebola Response and Preparedness

description.narrative: International Ebola Response and Preparedness. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Division of Global Health Protection (DGHP) leads CDCs efforts to help partner countries meet the goals of the Global Health Security Agenda. The Global Health Security Agenda aims to close gaps in preparedness and accelerate progress toward a world safe and secure from infectious disease threats. This work is critical to protecting health around the world and is focused on: (1) Disease surveillance and outbreak response, including establishing routine surveillance for priority diseases and developing information technology tools and systems; (2) Emergency management, ensuring countries have the knowledge and resources they need, including emergency operations centers that can mount a fast, coordinated response when outbreaks happen; (3) Safe laboratory systems and diagnostics, building the capacity to identify disease threats close to the source and inform decision-making; (4) Developing the workforce, training frontline responders, laboratorians, disease detectives, emergency managers, and other health professionals who are responsible for taking the lead when crisis strikes.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Comprehension HIV Prevention Care and Treatment for the National Defense Forces of Ethiopia under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Protecting and Improving Health Globally:Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems,Capacity and Security

description.narrative: Global Health Security Partner Engagement: Expanding Efforts and Strategies to Protect and Improve Public Health Globally. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Improving Coordination and Leadership of HIV/AIDS Programs in Ethiopia under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Support for the Provision of Sustainable Quality HIV Services and Attaining Impact in the Addis Ababa City Administration of Ethiopia under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Protecting and Improving Health Globally:Building and Strengthening Public Health Impact, Systems,Capacity and Security

description.narrative: Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries Protecting and Improving Public Health in Ethiopia. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) global health efforts are to assist Ministries of Health and other international partners to plan, manage effectively, and evaluate public health programs; achieve U.S. Government program and international organization goals to improve health, including disease eradication and elimination targets; expand CDC's global health programs that focus on the leading causes of worldwide mortality, morbidity and disability, including chronic disease and injuries; generate and apply new knowledge to achieve health goals; and, strengthen health systems and their impact.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Technical Assistance to Ethiopia's Federal Ministry of Health and Regional Health Bureaus in Comprehensive HIV/AIDS Programming and Direct Site-Level Support in the Four Emerging Regions under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Strengthening Family Guidance Association of Ethiopia Sexual and Reproductive Health Clinics and Youth Centers to Deliver Integrated and Comprehensive Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT), HIV Testing and Treatment under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.
